text: Prijemne tmave pivo ktore chuti rovnako ako vyzera. Horke ale nie az moc. Super :-)

On tap at several pubs in Prague. 
Highly drinkable, alcohol well hidden but stil apparent, nice hop notes, low roast, smooth, nuts and chocolate.

On tap. Black color, tan head. Aroma of brown sugar, chocolate. Taste is medium heavy sweet, not very bitter. Could be more bitter, but it is still good though.

On tap, @Na Spilce Plzeň. Viaje 03/2017
Color negro con una corona de espuma beige, sabor maltoso, cuerpo medio, floja.

From tap at Malostranska Pivnice with Gunnars ryk og reis 06.11.16. Ebony. Dense and persistent beige head. Rather moderate aroma, with dark caramel and brittle and a hint of herbs. Similar and stronger taste. Sweet, dark caramel in aftertaste.

Barwa brunatna, piana średnio intensywna, redukuje się do obrączki.
Aromat suszonych owoców w cukrze, przypalonego karmelu i toffi.
W smaku pełne i słodkie, karmel, przypalona skórka od chleba, alkohol wyczuwalny ale ułożony, cukier kandyzowany. Goryczka niska .
Very roasty aroma. Wonderful spicy taste and a long, roasty palate with caramel notes

Hyvin tummanruskea, käytännössä musta olut hyvin pienellä vaahdolla. Tuoksu hieman paahteinen ja kahvinen, ruisleipämäinen ja siirappinen. Maku maltaisen karamellinen ja makea, keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma. Jälkimaku kuivattaa kivasti kokonaisuutta. Toimii, mutta häviää piirun verran lajitoverilleen, äsken maistetulle Vakka-Suomen Schwarzbockille. Tämä ei ole niin maistuva, ei niin hyvä tuoksultaan, ei niin tyylikäs ulkonäöltään.
Deep black with medium beige head. Aroma is nuts and raisins, very finetuned malts. Taste is more raisins sweetness. Oily mouthfeel with fine bubbles. Not phenolic, long finish. Nice.

Tap. Black color with beige head. Aroma is chocolate, lacto, earthy-nutty. Taste is milk chocolate, some nuts. Sweetish, medium body, but overall light - would not guess this ABV. Smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation. Good Tmavy!
Tapping in to the pub Sabria Prievidza,sweet,roast malt flavour with coffee and licorice notes and full body,black with a red hue,aroma has roast malt.

On tap in Prague. Pours a dark brown, almost opaque, with a large frothy head. Smell is malty, with hints of caramel and chocolate. The hops arent far either. Taste is malty sweet with a lot of caramel and chocolate. Good bitterness towards the end. The alcohols warmth is also there. The carbonation is light, and the body is medium. Quite good!

Draft. Virtually black with a creamy white head. Aroma does not proceed much beyond roasted malt, although mine was admittedly served too cold for the style, which may have dulled it a bit. Taste is bitter with strong burnt malt notes, and a hint of coffee grounds. Finish is dry with a light sweetening and a bit watery. I found this one rather dull on its own but it makes decent company for food. Try it with pork knuckle, dumplings and cabbage.

On tap at Little Prague. Pours reddish brown with a small quickly disappearing head. Smell of caramel, a bit of roast and prunes. Quite sweet, flavors of caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, dark bread with mild bitterness. Medium bodied, sticky mouthfeel. Ok, but too sweet.

Draught sample at Little Prague, Tel Aviv. Brownish with small brownish head. The aroma has notes of prune, dried fruits and some chocolate. Sweet flavor with notes of prune and chocolate, bitterish, a bit spicy, watery. Medium-bodied.
Velmi chutné kávové, cítiť kakaové tóny, hrozienka-Slivky... jemné na jazyku pena karamel
Svart med to fingre høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter søtt, Melkesjokolade og noe malt. Søtsalt smak, mot salt lakris og kandissukker. Kort søtlig avslutning.
Deep black body with lightly brown creamy head. Nose of deep malts, raisins, ... Moderately sweet flavour, lightly bitter. Nice one.

F: big creamy, off-white to pale brown, long lasting.
C: dark, non-transparent.
A: roasted malt, caramel, grassy, some fruity, coffee, milk chocolate.
T: on tap, 0,4 l, sweet caramel malty, roasted tones, hint of alcohol, milk chocolate, plums, dark fruit, jam, hint of dusty/earthy tones, full body, average carbonation, quite complex, very good worth to try.

Dark brown colour with a good creamy head. Aroma is toasted malts and caramel with a little hop ends.
Taste is really nice. Sweet malt, lot of caramel and nice herbal end.
Really nice beer. One must

.4 L draft in snifter at brewerys restaurant in Pilsen (from notes). 

A - near black and opaque with reddish mahogany at edges/ Generous creamy tan head that leaves patchy lacing. Remnants of head lasted until the end during an entire meal!

Aroma - rather faint and not enticing aromas of medium and dark roasted malt. 

T  markedly more flavorful than aroma suggests: a somewhat spicy rich malt flavor that leads to a fine and lasting finish featuring dark roasted malts. Excellent balance of sweet and bitter, perhaps leaning towards bitter. 

M  Exceptionally creamy feel with perfect (med) carbonation

O  not great in every respect, but the wonderful mouthfeel alone makes this worth seeking out. 
Paired OK with broccoli in cheese sauce; excellent with pork in gravy.
On tap. Creamy tan-mahogany. A-roast/cocoa-dk malt. T-follows. Some dk fruit as it warms.
on tap in prague. a very thick hearty brew. nice contract to the pilsner. slightly sweet, good mouthfeel. went down pretty easy.
Bottle. Dark with small creamy beige head. Aroma of brown sugar and caramel. Taste caramel and dark fruit.
Vejvodu. Was called Master Special on menu. Beautiful Guinness-esque pour with head for a mile. Nice one but not as drinkable as some of the other tmavys.

Barwa ciemno brązowa, klarowna, piana sycząca, średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko opada do koronki. Aromat zadziwiająco przypomina koncernowego lagera, dopiero po chwili pojawia się delikatna nuta ciemnej czekolady, rodzynek i paloności. W smaku jest dużo lepiej - piwo dość gęste, średnio treściwe, jest i czekolada, i rum, i palone nuty - ogólnie dość słodko i brak tu goryczkowej kontry, praktycznie goryczka jest tylko w postaci lekkiego alkoholowego posmaku. W afterteasie pojawiają się wędzone czarne śliwki i kawa zbożowa. Nagazowanie średnie. 
Nie jest to złe piwo, choć jak na Portera Bałtyckiego troszkę mało wyraziste, raczej po słodkiej, deserowej stronie mocy. Wyraźnie brak tu chmielu, wyższej goryczki, która by zbalansowała tę słodową ciężkość.
0,5L draught at Kolkovna, Prague. Almost pitch black, beige creamy head. Roasted malty with chocolate and milky coffee, sweet tones too, soft mouthfeel. Low carbonation, light body (lager).

Kolor: ciemny brąz, klarowny.
Piana: jasno beżowa, obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość trwała. 
Zapach: średnio intensywny, słodowy, karmel, delikatna, kawa, czekolada, lekkie nuty ciemnych owoców, wyczuwalny również alkohol, ale w przyjemnej formie. 
Smak: piwo raczej smukłe, słodowe, tak jak w aromacie karmel, ciemne owoce, delikatna kwaśność owocowa, nuty melanoidynowe, opiekane, goryczka średnia w kierunku niskiej o przypieczonym, lekko palonym charakterze, alkohol wyczuwalny tylko przez lekkie rozgrzewanie w żołądku. 
Wysycenie: średnie, nie zapychające.

13.5.2014. Dark brown, white head. Aroma caramel malts, syrup, a bit roast. Palate is carbonated, has malts, syrup, liquorice, finish with simultaneous sweetness and dryness, and liquorice. Quite sweet but nice and smooth.
330ml bottle in Reykjavík. Aroma is chocolate, coffee. Appearance is black with a nice brown-ish head. Taste is bittersweet with a light dryness. Very good.

at Malostranská Pivnice Day 1 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 29/09/14. Opaque ruby red coloured pour, lasting thin grey / cream head. Aroma is nutty, caramel malts, bit of roast, dried malt extract. Flavour is composed of sweet malts, roast and nutty malts, slightly too sweet for me. Palate is sticky sweet cloying, moderate to low carbonation. Some lingering dried fruits and nuts.

Bottle @ friends. Appearance: pours clear reddish brown powerful off-white creamy head and good acing. aroma/taste: caramel, chocolate, wood and some floral hints. palette: medium carbonation, medium to full body, notable caramel sweetness, average bitterness, medium duration and an oily texture. Overall: tasteful dunkel with more roasted notes than usual

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 drunk at home, pours treacle brown with tan head. smells of olives, vinegar, cherries, earthy dark fruits smell. tastes of syrup, plums, some bitter earthiness there again. its ok but its not very punchy with any of the flavours
Fresh and good dark beer. Easy start with some grassy and malty aftertaste.

A nice bock to Baltic porter style beer enjoyed in Prague near the castle. Pour was dark dark brown, tan colored head, thinned quickly and laced ok. Aroma of bread and brown sugar and licorice. Flavor followed with some balancing light grassy hops. Moutfeel was slick, not dry, short of sticky. A nice one.

As a gift from Czech. I was rather doubtful about this one because of the commercial etiquette but therefor the surprise was even bigger, when I found out that it tastes too damn good. Malty caramel aroma, beautiful dark colour with a bit sweet (but also bitter at the same time) taste. Very delightful surprise!

(bottle) clear dark ruby-black colour with a frothy dark beige head. aroma of cherries, overripe peaches and acetone, with a hint of sugar icing, some toasted malts and walnut cake. flavour is mostly roasted malts, caramel and alcohol, only slightly sweet, with some notes of brown sugar, strawberries and dark chocolate. medium- to heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

Pitch black beer with a very small head. It smells intensively like spicy sherry with wooden, earthy notes. The start is sweet like caramel, fruity and some roasted malt. Very smooth and oily body. Soft carbonation. The 7% alcohol are noticeable and warming. I got a sticky mouthfeel after a few sips. Dry, wooden finish. In the end I smell more of the alcohol in the glass. Well balanced. Interesting beer and definitely worth tasting it.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Master Tmavý 18° ].[ Trade by Bamsen78 ]. Clear dark red brown color with a average, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, roasted, caramel, light sugary. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long duration, roasted malt, sugary, brown sugar. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140705]

Ran across this in only one eatery that i went to in Prague. Normally, everyone served either Urquell or Kozel. Gave this a try. Very, very good! Much better than Kozel (which wasnt bad). Poured black and creamy, good foamy head. Malty aroma, semi sweet flavor. Full body. Best thing i ran into in Czech Republic. Sorry it want available at more places.
Black colour with off-white head in 0.4 chalise glass. Foam going down fast no lancing. Citric aroma with roasty notes and dark fruits. Smoot coffee taste. A little oily. Light body.

Bottle from a store in Prague. Pours dark brown with garnet hints and a slight beige head. Aroma of treacle and moderately dark fruits. Med body or nearly. Flavor is darkish treacle with some prune/dark fruit.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head and a light treacle aroma. There is a hearty chocolate and dark fruit flavor with a dry finish.

Bottle 0,355l. Dark brown to black color with red sparkles, high pale brown head. Sweet malty aroma, tones of caramel, bread, plums, grains. Roasted. In taste the same: mostly dark malts, bread, toasted sunflower seeds, grains, some plum and caramel tones. Very sweet, light bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation. Interesting well balanced beer.

Bottle 0,355l. Very nice sweet aroma is like plum liquer, dark malty, some chocolate tones. Color is dark brown, clear, soft carbonation. Flavor is full and complex, sweet plum liquer, dark malt, grainy, bready, moderately bitter, tones of chocolate, caramel, coffee. Very pleasant, very good.

BOTTLE 355 ML from Slovak Crew.

Look: clear dark ruby, almost black, beige creamy head.
Aroma: crystal malts, faint toasted bread crust.
Taste: malty, caramel, moderate sweetness, balanced by light hoppy and lightly roasted bitterness. Nice, but unfortunately has some glue-like off-flavour.
33cl bottle thanks to Cuso. Dark brown color. Head is thin. Taste is medium sweet. Aroma is roasted, fruity, herby.

Draught at La Casa De La Cerveza, MadridBeautiful amber color with creamy head. Delicate malt and caramel aroma with noble hops and light biscuits. Smooth mouthfeel, with good caramel flavor, light biscuits, light residual sweetness, strong bitterness. Elegant and balanced.

Aroma: Sweet malt, caramel, dark bread and a little bit iron. Taste: Dark bread, alcoholic, coffee, caramel and dark chocolate. Good long finish. Good head with great lacing and average carbonation. Very dark brown colour.

Aroma is malt forward and slightly sweet. Pours a dark brown with little head or lacing. The taste has a polite malt sweetness and caramel notes initially with a floral/herbal finish. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Overall, very enjoyable.

Czech dark bock in German bottom-fermented style, with yellowish beige, moussy, stable head and very dark rusty brown colour, clear. Aroma pleasantly dark malty, chocolate, coffee liqueur, dried leaves, toasted bread, caramel, iron. Caramelly taste, sweetish and slick, chocolate and nuts, bit metallic, coffee-like roasted bitterness in the end almost tending towards a Schwarzbier, warming alcohol. Very nice and on a par with the best German examples.

Deep dark and rubbish color with a nice tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and some chocolate. Flavor follows the aroma with some sweetness. Medium carbonation with medium to full body with a dry roasted finish.
Really wonderful Dunkel with balanced aromas full of coffee, chocolate and malt. Highly drinkable with a nice, quite strong finish. Good one.

Half finger standing beige-tan head on the dark brown body with red tones, and curtains inside mug.
Aroma; fruit-liquorice, sweet mocca coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, berries.
Taste; dark chocolate malts, sweet coffee, prunes, currants, notes of cough syrup, dark caramel. 
Smooth, fully and easy on palate. Chocolate finish the mild way, medium lasting. 
Somewhat moreish. Good brew. 
[35.5cl brown-green bottle abv7.0%, BB04.04.14 - stored dark and cool, still very good!]

Bottle from trade with mmahut - many thanks, Marek! The beer pours out in a deep dark brown colour with steady head and smooth body. Aroma of malt and coffee. Taste of malt, coffee, chocolate, leaves, woods, oak and berries. Wonderful to drink, enjoyed it a lot.
Bottle.Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma of dried fruits and licorice,bready and roosted with smooth mouth feels and even flavour of chocolate and burnt hops.
Dark reddish brown of color with a beige head. An aroma of candy,dark chocolate and prunes. a flavor of malt, molasse, sugar, candy and dark bread.

Bottle, 7%, Very dark brown/red with medium beige head. Aroma is light roasted malts, chocolate, caramel and a little bread. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, bread, medium sweet, hop and little bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear dark reddish brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and a little roasted malt. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 050714
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, nuts, fruits, caramel and hops.

Bottle @ home. marrone, velata, schiuma beige abbastanza fine persistente. aroma tostato di caffè solubile, cacao amaro, nocciola, un po di salamoia delle olive. scaldandosi anche qualche nota di caramello.
Gusto secco, piacevolmente tostato, cacao amaro e caffè ben bilanciati con dolcezza alcolica. Luppolata , ma senza punte di amaro. Corposa, più calda della media delle Tmavy, poco carbonata. Rotonda, equilibrata ed armonica. Non è in linea con lo stile dichiarato ma è una buona birra.

Dark brown with a red tint but looks black at first with a lasting, frothy, tan, lasting, medium head. Smells of coco, roast and dark malt with caramel and a certain fruity freshness. Medium frothy oily body with soft carbonation. Tastes of chocolate malt, with coco, dark malt, raisin, and a bit of roast. Brings me back and keeps me wanting more. Very very drinkable.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is malt, coffee, sugar, caramel. Flavour is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, sugar, hop, caramel. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

Dark burgundy with a thin, tan head. The aroma is malty and sweet, full of brown sugar, caramel and a light fruitiness. The nose on this is really nice. Fairly full body with nice development on the tongue. The flavor is on the sweet side, but not inherently sweet on its own. Nice malts and a hint of bitterness at the finish.
Balanced and drinkable beer with overtones of roasted malts, great bitter-sweet taste, coffee and caramel aromas.

Bottle 0,355L. Clear, dark, ruby red/brown colour with average big, light brown, creamy head. Aroma of milk chocolate, caramel, roasted malts, cocoa, brown sugar. Taste starts light sweet with plenty of milk chocolate, while finish is sweet-bitter.Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Kinda unbelivable, but I bought such a good beer in a ordinary supermarket in Brno!

Producida por la compañía Plzeñský Prazdroj qur inició la fabricación de la cerveza Master en su sucursal de Velké Popovice en 2007, con el fin de enriquecer su oferta con algo especial. Comenzó a ofrecer entonces la cerveza Master tostada de 5,2 grados de alcohol y la negra de 7 vol, según recuerda Václav Berka, maestro cervecero.

?Ser aficionado a la cerveza no significa tomarse unos diez vasos de esa bebida. Hay que tener una cultura de tomar, e ingerir uno o dos vasos como máximo, para degustar la cerveza a fondo. Nosotros decidimos ofrecerle al cliente más exigente algo totalmente nuevo que, de seguro, no había probado todavía?, dijo Berka
El maestro cervecero señaló que la cerveza Master cuenta con una abundante espuma y un sabor muy diferente a las demás clases de cerveza fabricadas por Plzeñský Prazdroj. Este se debe a que, además del lúpulo de la región de ?atec que es de calidad superior, también se utiliza una malta de Baviera y, especialmente, una especie de malta caramelizada que le da a la cerveza un sabor a caramelo.

Hasta el presente Master es distribuida sólo en barriles y es ofrecida en unas mil cervecerías de la República Checa. Su venta se acompaña de un interesante ritual.
El ritual consiste en que en la cerveza se sumerge un pequeño pedazo de acero cirujano y, debido a la reacción química que ello provoca, ante los ojos del cliente se va creando sobre la copa una abundante, consistente a la vez que fina espuma en forma de flor. La espuma es tibia mientras que la cerveza es fría y esa combinación provoca una sensación especial en el paladar, por lo que el cliente vuelve a pedir otra cerveza Master?, afirma Berka.

En 2008, un año después de que se iniciara la venta de la cerveza en las cervecerías de la República Checa, ya se han vendido unos 9000 hectolitros. El sabor especial a caramelo de la Master es quizás la razón de que casi la mitad de sus consumidores sean mujeres. En vista del creciente interés, la compañía Plzeñský Prazdroj tiene previsto iniciar también su venta en botellas, se negocia asimismo la exportación a los países del norte europeo y a España.

Draught, 0.40l. Cloudy almost black color with thin creamy off.white head and good lacing. Aroma of caramel and mil roasted malt, nuts and chocolate. Tate starts with moderate sweet maltiness, follows by refreshing grainy sourness with warming spicy mouthfeel and medium bitter finish. Full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Incredibly drinkable, one of the best Czech beers so far...

Bottle from Alko Atomi. Black with med brown head. Nice Smoky aroma. Lasting Bitterness and some sweatness.

An almost black dark amber body with a quickly fading light brown head. Nose has rich aromas of chokolate, coffee, rye and dark syrup. Taste is sweet with a smooth dry finish. Carbonation is soft and the mouthfeel is rich and syrupy. This one has lots of character and a huge rich maltiness, very nice!

Dark brown colour, moderate creamy beige head; aroma of roasted sugar, dried berries, herbal notes and floral hops; taste of roasted sugar again, herbal notes and sugar - a bit too intensive sweetness.

0.355l bottle. Reddish dark brown body, light brown head. Lots of caramel and fruity esters in the aroma with some chocolate and roasted malts. Taste of chocolate, roasted malts, caramel and some booze. Silky texture, light medium body. Nice.
A czech dunkler bock, weird. Tastes like a very caramelised Belgian dark beer. Very malty and yeasty.

Tap at U Vejvodu, Prague. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy off-white head. The aroma is big roasted malts and a little yeast. The flavour is medium bitter/sweet with a smooth malt hop bitter palate and a short bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Its all about the malt, but its not bad at all. Went down rather easily!

Bottle in Prague. Pours clear reddish brown with small but thick beige head. Aroma is heavy roasted malt, prunes, gravy, beef stock and burnt/caramelised sugar. Taste is initial light sweet, then medium to heavy bitter/acrid and medium sweet. Body is creamy with soft to medium carbonation. Finish is long and medium bitter/sweet with notes of roasted malt, grilled beef, caramel and hints of grapefruit. Nicely balanced complexity.

Bottle. Its a clear, brown beer topped by a dense, beige head of finger-thick height. Lacings. The aroma is meaty with dark caramel, roasted malts, hints of coffee and a faint oxidised touch. The flavor is a tad too meaty I think, with some bitterness to support all the malty flavors. Caramel, roasted malts and some coffee hints. Full body, a bit sticky on the palate. Nice and soft carbonation level. Overall, a tad too sweet I think, but its a really fine brew anyway. 140207
On tap at U Vejvodu, Prague. Pours dark brown with beige head. Roasted coffee aroma. Roasted malt, caramel, flavor. Sweetish.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, vegetables, caramel and fruitines. Flavor is sweet and malty wih some coffee, caramel and nuts. Medium body, average carbonation
Raittiimpi Raivion Pentti. jos jälkimaku olis pidempi niin voisi saada enemmän pisteitä.

330ml bottle @ Pub Jaakko V, Kotka. Pours almost black with an off-white towards tan head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel-like tones as well as roasted malt and chocolate, and even some Saaz-style hops. The flavour is sweet and malty with weak bitterness. Sweet and grassy finish.

Almost black, dark brown beer with cloudy beige head dissolving soon leaving lacing and a permanent ring on top of the beer. Aroma and flavor have mämmi, syrupy sweetness, roastiness and little salty licorice. Palate is medium full, slick and lively carbonated. Finish is medium long and has fizzy carbonation and licoricy dryness. Pretty good Tmavy but gets a bit dull towards the end of the glass.

Big beige head. Clear barely translucent deep dark brown body.
Earthy caramelly oily aroma with fruity bubble gum notes.
Dry-sweet roasty licorice taste with delicate minty earthy notes.
Fullish body. Mild, soft, smooth mouthfeel. Dry-sweet minty
roasty oily aftertaste with caramelly toffee and cocos notes.
Delicate and full of flavour, well balanced and harmonic. Its
very sweet and full-bodied, but Im enjoying it all the same. (0.5l
bottle, wine monopoly web order.)
Dark brown. Long lasting brown head. Chocolate, coffee, malt, slight raisin aroma. Bitter, some sweetness. Medium mouth feel and carbonation. Good beer! Surprised me.

[Thanks to MisoW]. Bottled. Dark brown colour with a frothy and creamy beige head, medium lasting and nice lacework. Aroma is sweet with notes of yeast and toasted malts. Flavor is strong caramel, notes of toasted malts, brown sugar, slightly ripe fruit and toffee. The final is mild sweet with notes of burnt sugar.
Great dark beer. Malty and caramel taste with bitterness of hop combined in this full body beer. Head is dark and sticky.
Tapped. Very malted aroma, nice dark (almost black) appearance with a small but nice head. Rich body with nice thick texture, although a bit coffeed and not so rich. Finish is medium.

Draught. Very dark, almost black, with tall creamy beige head. Aroma has caramel, chocolate and alcohol. Flavor of caramel, roasted coffee and licorice in the end. Pleasant creamy/milky texture. Very nice beer.

Dark ruby color with one finger beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Very nice

Dark ruby color with thin off-white head. Aroma of sweet roasted malt and coffee. Taste is bittersweet , roasted malt dominate , had notes of chocolate , caramel , spices , hint of alcohol. Pleasant beer.

good full taste. soft with a bit of kick.very tasteful, beautiful dark color.-- via beerbasher/winphone

bottled. I kept this bottled over one year in my fridge. This beer is available also on tap here in Bratislava/Slovakia. I had it 2 years ago but I cant remember the experience anymore. Anyway, this bottled delicacy is great! roasted malt, some caramel, dark chocolate, espresso. it has a nice bitter coffee finish. Definitely a sipper. Overall a great dark lager!

Bottle 0,355l
Almost black/coffee color, under light a bit ruby. Nice beige foam. which dissaper quickly but leave little sheepskin. Aroma: soft smoked plum, a bit toasted-bread malts, chocolate liqueur, porto wine. Taste: chocolate mixed with bread, roasty malts. Sweet with nice a bit bitter finish. Creamy, smooth texture. Alkohol indiscernible. Very nice and drinkable beer.

Poured from 0,355l bottle. Clear dark ruby beer with tan head. Moderate retention with some lacing. Aroma of roasted malt with caramel, butterscotch and prunes. Sweet malty taste with light bitterness in finish. Full bodied with creamy texture. Carbonation average.
Nice beer for winter evening.
Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with chocolate, malts, ripe fruits, nuts and bread. Bittersweet finish with hops and roasted malts. Very nice dunkler bock.
Tap at urquell brewery, pilsen. Almost black color, smooth light brown head. Light aroma of roasted malts, wood. Balanced taste, roasty, malts, hops at the end.

330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Dark reddish brown with brown head. Aroma is sweet with malt, toffee and roasted malt. Taste is sweet with dark malts, toffee, licorice, coffee and alcohol. A tad too sweet

355ml bottle in Prague. Pours a deep, dark cola color with a small white head that has little retention. Nose is very subdued with notes of roasted malts, a little cocoa and coffee. Taste is mildly sweet and very nice! Like this a lot.
Det er en genial øl, der er afstemt på alle parametre. Skøn, mørk øl der bør nydes i Prag - den er iøvrigt meget svær at finde i handlen uden for Tjekkiet.
35,5 cl flaske. 7 % . Dejligt mørkt tjekkisk øl serveret i de rette omgivelser i den tjekkiske hovedstad, Prag. Fabelagtig god cremet kaffesmag. Suveræn

12oz bottle pours a translucent, mahogany amber with some bright white head. Nose of pumpernickel bread, cocoa pods, some toast, a little lightly roasted coffee, some raisin and prune. Flavors of chocolate, raisin, toasted almond, toasted whole grain bready, molasses. Full, sticky finish.

Bottle @ Pivovarsky Klub, Prague.
Sweet, caramel, mokka, burned malts, bitter nose.
Black color with a tan fading head.
Creamy taste, sweet touch, something burned, mokka, coffee.
Medium bodied, light burned bitter finish.
Bottle. Dark brown with good head. Aroma has roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is malty and sweet.

Cola-coloured beer with small head but it stays quite a long time. Roasted malts, hints of dark chocolate and some ryebread as well. Very dark flavor, lots of roasted malts. Some sweetness with some chocolate. Some herb type of bitterness at the end. Very pleasant mouth feel. Quite nice.
(bottle 18/05-2013) medium beige head, clear dark color, caramel aroma, high co2, light roasted caramel taste. BB date 27.07.2013.
Smell of roasted malts, licorice, coffee. Dark brown with mid-brown high head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Soft carbon. Aftertaste is artificial chocolate. Sweet, somewhat bitter.

Bottle: . Dark brown, light reddish color and a lazing brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of malt, toffee and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, toffee, licorice, coffee with a dry and roasted finish. A bit too sweet.
355ml bottle. Dark brown, with large beige head. Roast, syryp and choco on aroma. Taste: Sweet, fruity and toasted coffee. Medium + body, with creamy texture. Great bitterness on the end.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours dark, coffee black with a big brown head. Sweet, caramel aroma. Fine carbonation, full-bodied and a smooth mouthfeel. Malty flavour with lots of caramel and coffee. Sweet but not to sweet.  A bit dry aftertaste.
Bottle as gift. Black color with small beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, roasted malt. Flavor is bit roasted, malty, caramel, sweet.

Bottled. Dark ruby red color, thin lacy head. Grainy, slightly doughy maltiness, sourish ripe fruits, caramel, sweet herbal hoppiness, light and dry roastedness. Slightly sulphuric when warm. Malty sweet flavor, almost sugary start. Dryish finish has roastedness, moderate herbal bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonatioin, slightly sticky texture.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours dark black with a brown white big head. First taste is pretty much good combination of licorice and dark chocolate interesting and good taste.  Also notes of roasted malts and some coffee. Would probably suit well with some good meat meal.
Mild nose of licorice and malt. Pale brown fast disaqppearing head. Dark brownish black color. Malty and roasty taste of hops and chocolate and licorice and syrup.

Bottle. Dark brown, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate to full malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel, light roasted malt, dark bread. Medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel, light roasted malt with some dark bread. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, some caramel, light roasted malt and light dark bread, faint hoppyness and light alcohol. Sweetish dunkler bock with bread from SABMiller - alcohol makes the finish bit drier.

Bottle. Nice dark red with an ok tan hesad. Nose is caramel malt taste is nearly the same with a dort balanced hop note. I like this very much and on my next trip the to czech republic  will take home more.
Heavy mouth, excellent mouth feel. Strong alcohol although not so high being 7 %. This is a good example for the beer style.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 27.07.2013
Aroma is quite light with some sweet malty tones and syrup. Flavour is sweetish with malt, some berries, syrupy notes and hints of rye. Also some woody notes and dark chocolate. Smooth and creamy palate. Pairs ok with rye pudding. A dunkler bock in Bohemian way.

Bottle. Dark brown color with a medium sized beige head. Malty aroma with notes of dark bread and some fruitiness. Flavor is sweet malt, caramel, licorice and dark fruits. Medium body, a hint of bitterness in the finish.
.33l bottle in Kosice, Slovakia. Dark roasty brown-black, dark foamy head. Dark sweet, fruit caramel, some sweet alc. smooth medium dark sweetness, chocolate, red wine. not great, some cola going on.

Kaatuu lasiin hyvin tummanruskeana, reunoilta hieman valoa läpäisevänä, vaahto on parin sormen paksuinen ja sopivan tasaisesti katoava. Tiivistä pitsiäkin jää lasin reunalle. Haju on pääasiassa paahteisen ruisleipäinen, mutta mukana on myös limppua, maitoa, kahvia ja suklaata. Hieman lakritsiakin saattaa löytyä joukosta. Haju on oikeastaan jostain doppelbockin ja porterin välimaastosta, molempien parhaat puolet mukana. Maitohappoa voisi olla vähemmän. Maku on pääasiassa hyvin makean maltainen, jopa siirappinen. Siitä löytyy myös paahdettua leipäisyyttä ja suklaisuutta. Makeus kuitenkin peittää melko lailla muut alleen. Suutuntuma on tahmaava ja sitä kautta suht täyteläinen. Humalan kipristelyäkin löytyy. Hyvän ja monipuolisen hajuinen, mutta meikäläisen makuun aivan liian makea olut. Makeus peittää oikeastaan kaiken muun paitsi paahteisuuden alleen. Jos suositella pitää, niin jälkiruoaksi.
Dark brown body, offwhite head. Aroma is rich sweet dark malt and some fruits with alcohol. Flavour is sweet with hint of raisins and chocolate. Sweet and alcohol in flavour, too.
Solid strong black bock with good balance. Sweet taste without any overwhelming sugar.

A colablack beer with a medium and beige head. Aroma of bread, ryebread, sourness, hint of syrup. Taste is rich and malty, syrupbread, some syrup, quite sweet, nice drying hoppyness. Overally, the taste is still quite sweet, but balanced anyway. Medium+ bodied, medium refreshning carbonation. Quite sweet and ryebready beer.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 17.07.2013. Pours dark brown in color with a creamy beige head. Brown sugar, roasted malts and hints of coffee in aroma. Roasted malty taste, dark bready elements and slightly burnt wooden notes in taste. Not that sweet in taste as the aroma at first suggested. Quit dry. No sign of the alcohol in taste, even though you can feel how it warms of it after a while. Malty finish.

Pours dark brown with a small head disappearing quickly. Aromas of roasted malts, a hint of coffee and alcohol. Taste is mostly roasted malts, caramel and a hint of alcohol. Smooth but a tad too much carbonation. Pretty good, but I?ll rather take a Celebrator.
0,33l bottle from Alko. Pours very dark red with a low head. Aroma is roasted malts and coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, dark fruits and some hops. Quite nice.

Dark clear mahogany brown with big frothy beige head, lacing. Malty bit roasted aroma has some caramel and ripe fruits, grass. Sweet flavor, thin body and feel, typical dark czheck-beer, bit roasted finish dries bit also, alcohol. Ok dark czheck but not more.

355 ml, bottled. Pours dark brownish with a nice tanned head. Aroma: Roasted malt, coffee, old potatoes and caramel. Wooden notes. Taste: Fruity sweetness, roasty bitterness. Palate: Smooth, medium bodied. Average carbonation. Enjoyable.

355 ml bottle. Deep dark reddish brown coplour, thin tan head. Sweetish aroma of roasted, bready malt, with notes of liquorice. The flavour starts sweetish but quickly becomes drier, roasted malty, with notes of chocholate, coffee and fruits. Very nice.
bottle 355ml @ home. pours dark red brown with a large creamy head. dark malts, hay in the aroma. dark malts, dark sugar in the flavor.

355 ml bottle.
Pours dark copper-red color with a medium sized, thick head. Some nice vapor came out when the cap was removed. Aroma of burnt malts, caramel, some brown sugar, toffee and yeast, bread, subtle hints of honey on background.
Flavor of caramel malts, burnt bread, mild toffee, molasses and some yeast. Slick and somewhat sticky sugary palate with a long sweet and bready finish. Decent, maybe a tad too sweet though.

Fra fat på flyplassen i Praha 25 Okt 12. . Svart. God kaffearoma. Litt farget skum som varer en stund. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken er røstet malt. Svakt syrlig metallisk ettersmak. Litt kjedelig.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Pours nearly black with a white, rocky head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of roasted maltiness, licorice and rye bread - very malty. The palate is velvety smooth, medium bodied and sticky. This was a pleasant surprise for me, very nice maltiness, balanced between sweet and roasty notes.

Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted caramel, sweet toffee and light butter. Flavour is roasted caramel, butter, toffee and dried fruit.
Creamy white long lasting head. Dark amber colour. Malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitterness in flavour. Very good beer.

Bottle at Stopkova, Brno. Dark reddy Brown wit a beige head. Fruit and sweet with loads and loads of Malt character. Liquorice. Quite a full-on beer really. Full bodied and strong.

Pretty dark but clear with brown foam head, lasting and lacing to glass. Aroma is sweet caramel, taste is somewhat flat, bit disappointing. Short bittersweet aftertaste. (Velp 201210)

Brune, col léger beige.

Thx. to Sebletitje for sharing the bottle. 355 ml bottle split by 2. That label design, is that supposed to be satanic or what or perhaps yee oldy medieval plain fear mongering Christianity style? Pours a brown ruby amber with a very brief head. Smells of lager yeast, mocha, chocolate, nuts, plenty of chestnuts and some spices. Taste and body could have been a tad fuller but certainly more substantial than quite a few German examples I have encountered so far. Light bitter and metallic with actually some hops in the finish, lager yeast buried a bit under oily nuts blended with licorice and some molasses, caramel and touch of chocolate. Bit oily body, not a bad bock.

On draft at the Original Pilsner Urquell Restaurant at the Prague airport. Pours a dark cola with a thick tan lingering  head. Raisin aroma. Toffee and butterscotch with a hint of bitterness in the finish.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty caramel and dark fruit aroma. Sweetish malty caramel licorice flavor. Has a roasted malty licorice and caramel finish.
Dark pour from the bottle with a raisin taste.  Aroma of sugar and booze.  No lacing.  Head hands around for a while.  Mouth is a little thin on this.

Pours a very dark red/brown colour with decent head. It has a strong toffee and slightly chocolatey and sweet aroma. Taste is not too heavy or strong but retains some of the aroma in the taste. The finish does however turn towards a drier hoppier end.

Had in Kiev.  Dark golden brown.  Lots of fun toffee notes but dominant diacetyl.  Same thing on the palate.  Wish this was fresh, or maybe that it doesnt taste like butter.  That could be deliberate.

On tap at Na Zaverce. Pours dark amber to black color with creamy tan head. Aroma is licorice, roast, caramel, wood. Taste is roast, hops, caramel, licorice. I like tap version much more than the bottled one I had a few times.

355ml bottle from a Billa store in Bratislava. Pours a rosewood coloured body and a tan-coloured head, some of it remaining. Spotty lacing. Sweet dark malty to the nose. Anise and cocoa in flavour added by a little roastiness. Bittersweet malty ending. Notes of inoffensive alcohol. Nice, maybe a bit heavy to drink (Cabin at MS Rügen, 02.08.2012).
Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Butter, caramel, and  hint of roast and hopjesvla in the aroma. Full bodied. Malty sweet buttery flavor. Roast and hopjesvla. Interesting beer.

Deep dark body and small creamy dark beige head. Caramel like sweetness with darker notes. Butter candy as well. Decent. Fairly smooth body, which accentuates the inherit sweetness - a sweetness from non-burning alcohol and nutty malts. Not Belgian though, the yeast is too classic and the dryness from a dark lager. Not bad, but also not really my thing. I light it sweeter or hoppier. (33cl bottle)

Draft at Beer Sommelier in Kiev. Tan head on opaque nearly black body. Looks great. Sweet butter overwhelms aroma, and unfortunately the palate is slick and oily. Beneath this is a nice malt character and good beer that is sadly tainted by age, poor condition, or both...hope to rerate!

330ml bottle. Very very dark brown, almost black color. Small beige head, stays. Coffee, plums, roasted notes and chocolate. Malty, coffee, plums, mild bitterness and chocolate in flavor. Very smooth and easy to drink. Very well balanced.

Bottle. Dark brown with a rather big head that lacks in sustain. Lovely aroma of caramel, chocolate, wood, Saaz hops and roasted malt. Partly vinous and reminiscent of portwine. Sweet taste, full bodied, with a chocolate-carmelly-vinous flavour, mellow mouthfeel, light bitterness, a subtly warming finish. Subtle roasted and mineral notes in the finish. Very good!

33cl Bottle from Carrefour Bratislava. Black colour, creamy beige head. Aroma of liquorice, sweet coffee, some dark fruits, cream. Flavour is medium sweet, liquorice, dark malts, light roast, light bitter finish with a little alcohol. Medium-bodied, soft creamy mouthfeel. High drinkability. Id not classify this as a bock though, more of high ABV dunkel or baltic porter.

On tap at a local bar in Prague. Nice dark rich color with a nice head. Finally taste, chocolate and malt with a whopping 7 per cent alcohol, wnich is high in these parts. Nevertheless, solid Dunkel Bock, first
beer in Germany / Czech that I wanted a second glass of.
On tap in Prague. Pours a dark black with an off white head and aroma of chocolate and alcohol. Taste is of chocolate, roasted malt alcohol, and liquorice with a long, warming finish.

Quite full bodied with rather heavy sticky palate and long sweetish finish. Not bad although might be a bit too alcoholic considering the ABV.

On tap. Dark with a tan head. Sweet, roasty, coffee, some caramel, touch spicy and some bitterness. Pretty good.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is roasty malt, caramel. Flavour is mocca, roasty malt, molasses. Nice one.
Bottle at home. Black pour, thin off-white head. Aroma is sugary, roasty, caramel. Flavor is roasty sweet, caramel and slightly bitter spicy.

Ruby red tinged dark brown color. Slim layer of tan bubbles atop. Little to no lacing. Big notes of molasses and fig. Tastes the same with a big malt backbone. A little alcohol presence to thin it out. Pretty good.

Bottle, 33cl - Semi clear dark brown red beer with a small head. Aroma is malty with notes of milk chocolate, dark syrup, rye bread and some herbs. Flavor is malty with notes of coffee, dark syrup, alcohol and herbs. Sweet and kinda cloying but I find it quite enjoyable.

Bottle sample at a tasting at m place. Thanks beerandbeyond. Pours dark opaque with tan head, smells grainy, a little alcohol, rust and ink. Tastes roasted, serrt with some alcohol. Smooth, light body, alcoholic finish.

Bottle at home in London. Pours clear, red-brown with a large, foamy, beige head. Some toasty malts in the nose with hints of chocolate. Dark brown with small head. Aroma of chocolate and banana as well as the taste. Not very special but nice.
Very dark brown, ok head, but should hold some longer. Roasted malts and dark fruits, spices. Good earthy, spices, chocolate and coffee notes.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black colour. Medium head, quickly deteriorating. Aroma of caramel, coffee, chocolate, roasty, well balanced. Taste medium sweet, light bitter. Finish sweet, but light, rather indistinct.

Bottle @ home, gift from a colleague (thnx Anja&Jan!). Very dark brown, almost black, with a deep dark red glow coming through. Love this color! Small beige head that doesnt last. Nästan svart öl med ett svagt skum. Doftar en hel del choklad och nötter, smakar detsamma samt vanilj och har en fräsch sötma. Flaska 33 cl i Prag.

chocolate, citrus, herbs, bubblegum, rotten eggs, raisin, leather, nuts, brown, brown foam, rocky head, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, umami, full body, sticky, creamy, oily feel, bitter, long finish,

Bottle from Jednota supermarket, Bratislava.Dark brown beer with small beige head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste, caramel, coffee, milk chocolate, toffee. Coffee like finish. Nice.

Egészen sötét, vörösesbarna színe van, ami erős fényen keresztül látható csak át. Habja közepes méretű, krémes, bézs színű és elég kitartó. Illata, kávés, pörkölt magvas, kissé gyógyfüves, fásan fanyar és kissé dohos. Ízében is ezek érződnek egy kis füstös és gyümölcsös zamattal, karamellával kiegészülve,még több kávéval és étcsokoládéval, amihez még pluszban járul egy jó adag fás íz. Közepesen testes és szénsavas, a magasabb alkoholtartalom szépen elvan benne rejtve. Utóíze keserédes és kissé fanyar, kiszárítja a szánk teljes belsejét. Kellemes és érdekes porter, talán lehetne egy kicsit sűrűbb, de finom.

Süßlich hefiger Antrunk mit vollmundiger Malznote. Diese nimmt im Mittelteil noch Fahrt auf, danach wird sie etwas röstig. Im weiteren Verlauf nähert sich das Aroma dem einer Bitterschokolade an und wird außerordentlich vollmundig. Wenig herb, daher sehr süffig. Im Abgang stark würzig und angenehm süß mit leichten Kräuternuancen. 13/13/12/13//12

(bottle, 35.5cl) Clear, dark brown colour with a beige and dense medium-sized foamy head. Roast-malty aroma with caramel and coffee, accompanied by subtle notes of dried fruits. Sweet and roasty bitter flavour, full bodied with a smooth carbonation. Roasty malt-character with caramel, coffee and delicately and slightly vinous fruity notes; sweet and mildly roast-bitter finish with delicately dried fruity notes. Pleasant and soft, just a tad too sweet. 12.V.11

Saboreada en Dic/10.Servida en botella de 33 ml. Negro intenso en copa Snifter (Master). Corona Consistente y cremosa. Burbuja pequeña y espuma persistente de color beige. En nariz notas de malta tostada y agradable aroma a lúpulo. Tu boca recibirá un sabor a caramelo y regaliz. Seco y suave amargor en tu paladar. Buena carbonatación. En el retrogusto volverá el caramelo y la malta tostada. Fácil de beber, cuerpo medio, refrescante y de sabor agradable. Mejor no olvides que tiene 7.0 % Alc.Tasted on Dec 2010. Served in 33 ml bottle.Pitch black in your Snifter. Thick & creamy crown. Small Bubbles & extended foam, beige in color. In nose oasted malty notes & a gentle hop aroma. Your mouth will receive a caramel & licorice flavor. Dry & smooth bitterness in your palate. Good carbonation. At the aftertaste will return caramel & tosted malts. Easy to drink, medium body, refreshing & kind flavor. You´d better remember it´s 7.0 ABV

U Pinkasú, Prága. Nagyon sötétbarna, majdnem fekete színe van, a fényben bíborárnyalattal csillog, habja bézs színű és kissé krémes, ugyanakkor tömör, viszonylag kitartó. Illatában először az erősen pörkölt malátát és kávét érezni, de van egy kellemes meggyes, aszalt szilvás, gyümölcsös aromahalmaz is benne, valamint egy kis égetett cukor. Ízében már nem olyan erőteljesek a pörkölt jegyek, de azért érződik a kávé, egy kis keserű csoki társaságában, az aszalt szilvás, meggylikőrös édesség közé befurakodik egy gyógynövényes mellékíz is, lecsengése komlósan gyümölcsös, igen száraz. Meglehetősen testes, nehézkesen mozog és eléggé édes is. Kortyokban fogyasztandó, nem hétköznapi sör.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2012 Bottle. Dark brown, beige head. Clearly roasted, malty nose, chocolate, butter, hops. Medium body, rather sweet, medium bitter. Malty, fruity, roasted taste, buttery notes, coffee, alcohol rounds off quite nicely. (2010-11-28)

Bottle from Pivovarsky Klub, Prague. Pours dark Coke coloured with a big frothy beige head. Aroma of roasted caramel and dried fruit. Taste is moderate sweet light roasted malts. Sticky mouthfeel. Lingering caramelly sweetness, before it ends dry and roasted, good beer.

On tap at Na Spilce, Plzen. Colour; darkest brown to black, with creamy tan head. Nose; malty, wood, coffee, pear drops and some whiskey. Soft carbonation. Taste; initially sweet - malty, cocoa, caramel, treacle. Leads to smoky, wood, dark fruits (cherries, dates), with a decent hoppy finish. Better than expected!
Bottled. Black color. Slightly foamy. Caramel malt. I must say better than my favorite Czech black beer (Kruovice). But its 18° is way too much.

355ml bottle from a supermarket under the Tesco in the city centre of Prague.
A decent beer :-)
Bottle, dark brown color. Quite malty aroma with grassy tones. Flovor of roasted malts, some chocolate. Drinkable.

0,33 l bottle as a gift.
Dark ruby near black with a nice stable, foamy and creamy light beige head. Moderated roasted aroma with some fruity yeast, caramel and molasses, some chocolate. Medium bodied beer with sweet caramel and molasses, some dark fruits and roasted grains. Some bad straw-like aftertaste...Not so powerful than expected but good one, an "exciting" one from a mass producter...

It was very dark, with a coffee coloured head, and sweet nose. The first taste was ok I guess, nothing more than that really, just ok. Lightly roasted flavours, a touch of sweetness and a mild hoppiness, as I say nothing special. The thing that worried me was that after about 15 minutes, was drinking slowly yesterday, it started to smell overwhelmingly of sauerkraut.

Tap at a random place in Prague.  The beer pours to a deep brown body with a tan head.  The aroma was kind of Belgian Dubbel crossed with European Strong Lager.  The flavor was sweet, seemingly flawed even though I couldnt pin-point it., more Belgian Dubbel than Baltic Porter.  While drinking I was thinking European Strong Dark Lager.  The palate was sweet and robust.

Tap @ Olutravintola Malja. Rated @ 21.11.2009.
Poured a black colour with a creamy head. Excellent retention. Sweet flavour with caramel notes. Flavour is medium sweet with caramel malts, fruits and yeast notes. Alcohol comes through in the end. Dry finish. Soft carbonation. Very nice.

Dark brown color with nice white head. Huge molasses and dark chocolate exudes from the nose. The body is surprisingly light. A tad sweet, but fairly balanced and good depth.  Molasses are just everywhere with some dark fruit. Lingering molasses finish. Smooth and delicious.

Bottle poured with a large, foamy, frothy, fluffy, tan head that lasts and some lace. Color is a dark brown with garnet highlights. Aroma is malt, toasted barley, toffee, caramel, and nutmeats. Flavor is similar with some malty sweetness coming out but not too much. Tasty. Body is good and so is carbonation. Finish is like flavor, medium in length and has a alcohol present. Easy drinking, good beer. Session

Draught at the Cafe Imperial in PRague. Wood-coffee--chocolate nose. Very sweet flavor, with caramel and chocolate. Not much balance to it. Cloying, thick, and sweet. Ok, but rather cheap tasting and industrial. Not impressed.

Black with finger thick creamy tanned head. Excellent lacing. Wooden, roasted, herbal and alcoholic character to the aroma on the nose. Liqorice and roasted malts on the tongue. Sweetness and bitterness is well balanced. Medium body, Juicy/syrupy texture leaving a dry finish. A real treat.

0,355l bottle, nice browny creamy head, totaly black, roasty and citrus aroma, medium bitterness, heavy cloying sweetness, full body, slick feel, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter, I never had this beer on tap but from bottle is a good product.
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: draught at Lucerna, Praha. Deep black colour, creamy beige head. Incredibly intensive and complex arom aof chocolate, blackberries, blackcurrant and chocolate, also coffee. The same in the flavours. Full-bodied, intensive and complex. Really delicious, much much better than expected. I can hardly believe this comes from a huge industrial brewery.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2010 Tap, in Prague near the Hrad (castle). Big creamy head, dark,a lmost black coloured. Aroma is sweet with roasted malts with some nutmeg and nuts. Chololate and coffee. Smooth to drink, with a good bitterness. I didnt notice the ABV was somewhat higher, After a long walk it seemed the alcohol was working well. NIce.
Draught @ Malja, Kuopio, Finland. A good baltic style porter with a medium body and roastness.
draft. dark sweet beer with caramelish palate and hoppy flavour. very nice glass!

Tap @ U Vejvodu, Prague. Pours dark brown with a creamy lasting beige head and lacings. Nose is caramel, roast and dried fruit. Smooth and soft. Vaguely sticky. Sweet and a bit buttery but it has a fine roasted bitterness. Ends dry and roasted. Good.

Draft at U Sudu at Prague. I think the milk stout can be like this, because it has a milky body with fine chocolate flavour. An off-white creamy head. In the aroma there are also caramel notes, roasty malts. It surprised me.

Pours black color, beige large head. Very roasted malty aroma, sweet and caramel flavour. Very good brew.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 (draught 0,4l) (13.9.2009) 
Clear black color. Large creamy brown head. Roasty aroma. Bitter chocolate taste. Light bitter. Medium body. 
( 6 . 4 . 6 . 3 . 12 = 3.1)

(Bottle 0,355l) (15.9.2010) 
Roasted malt, caramel, coffee, light spicy, light chocolate aroma. Nice comprehensive aroma, but not last long. Dark brown-red color. Medium brown head. Medium sweet. Roasted, caramel taste. Light sticky, light oily texture. Dry, light bitter chocolate aftertaste. Light alcohol warm finish.
( 7 . 4 . 7 . 3 . 14 = 3.5)

(Bottle 0,355l) (5.3.2014) 
Sweet, dried fruits, sirupy aroma. Dark brown-black color. Medium, light brown head. Very sweet, dried furit, light roasted malt flavor. Medium body. Light dry, light astringent, warm finish. Not as good as before. Quite dull for 18°. 
( 6 . 3 . 6 . 3 . 12 = 3.0)
Sampled in Prague. A very good brew. Full of very intense malts, served in a nice glass this beer has solid creamy head. Pretty dark ambery with a plethera of malts and caramels. Pretty good brew.

Draft. A very dark brown beer with a red shine under a lazing brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, caramel, and licorice, leading to a dry, bitter, and roasted finish. Too sweet and too alcoholic for my liking.
Bar none, the best beer I had in the Czech Republic. Very nice. Dark, smooth, creamy. Obey your master.

Draught at Hotel Duo, Prague. Amber color, creamy beige head. Malty buttery aroma, milky and with vinegar notes. Maybe this beer was close to turning old. Malty diacetyl flavor, nutty, some chocolate and licorice and milk. Thin to be a porter.
Draught. Weak liquorice aroma, slightly sweet. Black colour, red shine. Small stable light brown head. The flavour is quite sweet, good liquorice note. A bit vinous. Creamy mouthfeel.

on tap at na parkanu. close to black with a lasting beige head, aroma of prunes, chocolate milk and a hint of burnt hay. pretty sweet with some molasses, peach syrup and coffee powder. somehow i always find this underwhelming, it just doesnt have much of an edge to it and isnt in the same league as the kout baltic porter

On tap. Completely opaque black with a tall, dense and velvety beige head leaving a lovely curtain of lacework. Aroma of hard roasted malt and coffee. Quite full-bodied with a very solid malt base, plenty of hard roasted malt, burned caramel and sweet licorice. Surprisingly subdued bitterness. A meal in a glass really. 280608

[on tap at Na Parkanu, Plzen]
Sugary banana candy aroma with lots of dried fruit and walnuts. Opaque black with very nice lacing and a thin white cover. Sweet molassesy malt flavour with some ethanol adn notes of prune and raisin. Low bitterness. Full body, moderate carbonation, sour straw finish.

Dark brown with medium beige creamy head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt, chocolate, overripe and caramel notes. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, sweet liquerice, caramel, ripe fruits and mild hoppy notes. Ends bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2012 Re-rate 3/10/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmks place. Thanks beerandbeyond. Very dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel and licorice. Sweet malty flavor with caramel, molasses, a bit of roastiness and light coffee notes. Medium-bodied. 5/3/5/3/10=2.6

(6/26/08) Draught at Na Parkanu in Plzen. Dark brown to black color. Aroma has light roasted malt, some hints of licorice and alcohol. Sweet flavor, slightly alcoholic, with malt and some licorice - not so pleasant. Medium-bodied. 5/4/4/3/8=2.4

Draught) Pours almost black. The aroma is of light roasted malt with tones of caramel, dark berries, dark fruits, liquorice, mild molasses, some hops and violet. The flavour is light roasted and tiny caramelly with undertones of liquorice, violet and a light hoppiness. The mouthfeel is light sticky and light creamy. Light to medium sweet and light bitter.  Medium bodied.

(Draught at U Sadu, Prague, 20 July 2008) Dark brown colour with ruby hints, creamy beige head. Malty nose with full aromas of chocolate, roasted malt and caramel. Roasted, malty taste with dark rye bread, chocolate, cocoa and molasses. Full body, syrupy mouthfeel. Decent, but with an industrial feel to it and slightly too sweet.
Tap @ Na Parkanu, Plzen. Almost black coloured with a medium sized head. Malty with notes of ryebread, liqourice, brown sugar, caramel and dark fruit. A bit too mild.

Black with a red hue, and a firm and lasting light brown head. Aroma has roast malt, licorice, charcoal, and some fruityness. Sweet, roast malt flavour with coffee and licorice notes, and a full body.

Tap @ Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Pours a very deep mahogany with a medium, creamy, light-beige head. Super lacings and a good duration on the head. Aroma is mild, rather sweet with brown sugar and lightly roasted malts. Okay, lightly creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is very malty sweet, but gains respect with a good roastiness and chocolate in a strong, long aftertaste.

Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen. 
Dark brown colour with tan head. Darker malt aromas such as chocolate and toast. Sweet, almost sticky mouthfeel with lots of chocolate, bit of caramel and little plum.

Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Very dark brown coloured, small beige head, mild alcoholic nose. Roasted malt, caramel and coffee taste with notes of nutts and burnt sugar. Smooth. Moderate bitterness and obvious alcohol presence.

Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Black beer with brown head. Phew, this was a big sweet beer, loads of alcohol in the mouth but ending up quite smooth. There is some roasty malty notes, but largely hidden by the general sweetness of the beer. Plummy fruitiness late on. It could have been a monster if it had brewed out more of the sugars, but reasonable all the same.

On tap at Na Parkanu.  Black, thin beige head.  Alcohol burn on end.  Some burnt malt, charcoal.  It’s ok, burnt, a bit to burnt and too much alcohol.  Some fullness, but it lacks something.  A tad sweet too.

From tap at Na Parkanu. Pours dark brown with a two finger thick tan head. Roasted malt aroma with distinct fruity complex nose. Light fruity accent too. Flavour is sweet fruity and mild liqourice to a solid roasted caramel malt base. Smooth toasted caramel malt finish. Great brew.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2008  Draught at Na Parkánu, Pilsen.  Very dark brown, small beige head. Aroma of sheer molasses. Sweet and caramelly. Full bodied with some coffee and syrup. Finishes with medium bitterness. Primitive undeveloped flavours.

RBESG, on tap at na Parkanu, alongside (iirc) Per, Barak and Patrik Deep brown/black body, beige head. Nose of caramel, dust and alcohol. Sweet malty taste, weak roastiness, some notes of apples, dryish mouthfeel, caramel again. Erm, ok, but really nothing speciall, especially for the style.

You know you are drinking this because it wrestles your taste buds of the mouth.  The taste is heavy, not too heavy, but you know that this is more of a sipping beer than gulping. It needs to be savoured. Does have the usual dark, roasted flavour the dark (Tmavy) beers have, but the simple strength of the beer washes it quickly away.
Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Deep black with a brown edge and medium beige head. Chocolate malt aroma with some roasted coffee notes. Medium bodied and smooth. Ok balance, dry finish.
Tap at this pils urquell tap place. Alround rating: Thin over carbonated, roasty one dimentional and boring. One glass did 5 of us, so you get the idea.

Draught @ Plzensky Prazdroj. This was a big surprise not know what it was that I was being served. Expecting the usual Czech Dunkel or similar. Large and very lovely looking creamy beige head that really lasted. Excellent display of lacework. Pitch black color. Aroma was quit complex with notes of roasted malt, coffee, dried fruit, sweet chocolate, butterscotch. Over the palate came liquorish and even a hint of smoke. Also notable was of cause the earthy floral notes of the hops.  Medium to almost full bodied with a soft carbonation and creamy light dry texture.  Lingering sweet liquorish like finish. Wow this one rocks.

On tap at Prague airport.
Nutty, sweet,. Pleasant, but a bit one-dimsional. A little sourness develops in the finish, lifting the beer a little.

In short: A surprisingly roasted (by Czech standards) doppelbock.  Almost a north-American Stout but with a Czech lager.
How: Tap at Na Parkanu, Pilsen, Czech Republic
The look: Black body with a medium beige head
In long: Nose is roasted, slightly fruity and with coffee notes.  That takes you to North-America Imperial Stout territories.  Body is medium, roasted caramelized malts and some red fruits.  Finish is a bit lemony/citric.  A decent bottle beer but nothing really standing out.  Senior Apprentice Tmavý 18°.
Enjoyed this beer in the outdoor area of a restaurant in the shadow of Karlstejn castle. Wonderful brew.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Na Parkanu (Plzen, Rép. Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur de céréale grillée avec une pointe chocolaté. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun moyen col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel fruité avec une pointe de torréfaction. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût fruité. (Rating #1554)

My Bottom Line:
Cherry-filled chocolates morph into caramel in this slick and nourishing Czech Doppelbock.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam stays atop the copper-hued dark brown.
-Fruity tartness whispers by.
-After a bunch of quaffable Bohemian Pilseners, this may appear heftier than it actually is.
-Lightly toasted maltiness completes the complex grain bill.
-Some wooden hop bitterness attempts to dry out the back end.

On tap at Na Parkanu.

Tokyo and Eastbourne (?!) aside, probably the most expensive draught beer Ive ever bought anywhere in the world. Ever. (Prague Airport). But it was a steal compared to the £47 shots of whiskey on offer. Anyway...even at ten times the price you might pay for a superior beer elsewhere in town, this was not a disappointment. Mahogany with ruby tints and beige lace. Nutty dark malt and dried fruit aroma. Silky palate fat with chocolate malt, liquorice, pruney dark fruit and late lingering vanilla and biscuit. At the time the best Czech beer Id ever had...

Tap at Punavuoren Ahven, Helsinki as "Master of Dark (?)". Pretty much black with nice small thick head. Malty and a bit roasted nose. Flavor is very roasted, with chocolate, cold coffee and a very sweet and slightly sour backbone. Full, tasty and enjoyable. I quessed it would be a porter.

Draught at Vihreä Haltiatar, Jyväskylä. Dark mahagony color with very thick creamy head. Very malty and chocolatey aroma. Rich malty flavor with notes of cocoa, chocolate and licorice. Full bodied, soft, milky and creamy palate.

Keg (Pikkulintu, Helsinki)
Dark, red highlights, tight head. Good simple malt and maybe husks, perhaps even nuts, taste. Slightly creamy sweet light malt aroma. A bit carbonated, so a bit harsh. Nutty bitter finish. Hides 7% very well.

Draught. Deep murky brown head with mediumsized foamy brown head. Aroma is mildly roasted malts along with some grass and a weird sour note. Flavour is mildly roasted, some caramel and quite much sweetness. The alcohol doesnt show except for a nice warming touch in the throat when the beers goes down.

On draft @ an Irish pub just off Staromestke Namesti in Prague.  Pours a deep garnet brown with sizable offwhite head into a tulip style glass.  Nose of sweet rich malts, brown sugar, maple syrup, rich and syrupy body, roasty caramel on the palate, mild pleasant tartness towards the finish with minor bitterness.  Alcohol is present and unusually strong for a czech beer.  Quite a surprise, as I had no real idea what I was in for.

On tap: Dark amber with ruby spots, very stable creamy tanned head, caramel, dark malt, raisins and port in the nose, moderate sweet flavour, astonishingly light bodied for a beer of 7% ABV, well hidden alcohol, lingering sweet-caramelly finish with some mild bitterness in the aftertaste. A well quaffable Bohemian Doppelbock........

On tap at Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Surprisingly heavy for a Czech beer. This one is dark brown, almost black with a nice lasting head. Very sweet and malty aroma. Dominated by caramel and roasted malts this is close to cloying saved only by a hoppy note. Found it a bit thin for all the flavour and alchohol. But ok for a not too warm autumn day I guess.
Tap... what an amazing beer! One of the best beers Ive ever had. Great feel and finish.

Near black colored, huge lasting beige head. Sweet and caramelly, very rich aroma, roastiness also obvious here. Medium bodied. Flavor starts also with mild sweet caramel, roastiness also present. Aftertaste turns to well hopped, still caramel there with mild alcohol. Good one, still body could be fuller at these ABVs.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2008 First rating(Draught at U Mansfelda, Plzen) Very deep dark ruby red color, fluffy creamy tan head. Acidic malty with hints of roasted malt scent, though rather tame scent, just as was the case with the Master 13 degree. Hoppy bitter and sweet malty taste with a roasted aftertaste. Spritzy mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.6/4/6/3/12=3.1Rerate(Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen)On June 26, 2008)Dark brown to black color, light brown head. Sweet, roasted, soapy, hoppy scent. Sweet, hoppy, grassy, roasted, caramel taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.7/3/7/3/13=3.3

Super clear dark brown body, light brown head; Very simple caramel malty nose, boring but alright; Simple body with a soft texture, bitter and to sweet; Very sugary finish plain dark cane sugar aromas, only very little bitterness and way to much sweetness. Not pleasant.

Sweet, caramelly, and some ;lightly roasted malt notes. Soft mouthfeel, quite round, but feels a touch empty, some alcohol noticed in the finish.

Draught in Prague - a nice bar in the same street as U Fleku and Hotel Pav. Black - offwhite head. Roasted, burned, licorice, high licorice, light hoppy, light citrus, light body. Big mouthfeel -> Finish.
